cardiac_history: No cardiac symptoms. Recent EKG normal. No chest pain, palpitations, or dyspnea. Active lifestyle, runs regularly.

expected_issues.description: Cardiac stress test billed for asymptomatic patient with no cardiac indications

documents.content: 35-year-old male presents for annual physical. Patient reports feeling excellent, exercises regularly (runs 3-4 miles, 4 times per week). No chest pain, no palpitations, no shortness of breath. No family history of premature CAD. Non-smoker. Vitals: BP 118/72, HR 58 (athletic), regular rhythm. Physical exam: Heart RRR, no murmurs. Lungs clear. No concerning findings. Recent lipid panel excellent: Total cholesterol 165, LDL 88, HDL 62. Patient is low risk, no indication for cardiac stress testing.

line_items.description: Periodic comprehensive preventive medicine, established patient, age 40-64
Cardiovascular stress test using maximal or submaximal treadmill
